result.taxonomicnotes: The validity of the species is doubtful since its type locality matches that of paratypes material of A. tarijae and diagnosis is not so clear. Ochoa (2019) suggested that A. ortii is synonymous of A. tarijae.
result.rationale: This species is listed as Near Threatened (NT). It has a restricted extent of occurrence (EOO) of 2,756 km<sup>2</sup> based on its distribution in Villa Montes, Pilcomayo River, Bolivia. The main threats are water pollution and abstraction, primarily due to agriculture and mining. There is a single location based on these threats. However, at present there is no evidence of continuing decline in habitat extent or quality.
result.geographicrange: This species is only known from the Pilcomayo River, near Villa Montes village, Tarija Department, Bolivia (Arcila et al. 2013).
result.population: This species seems common in the upper potion of the Pilcomayo River in Bolivia.
result.habitat: This species lives in streams and ponds in the foothills of the Pilcomayo River basin in Bolivia.
result.threats: Water contamination by intensive mining and wastewater in the upper and middle portion of the Pilcomayo River in Bolivia is a threat. Deforestation in the middle portion of the Pilcomayo River basin due to changes in the use of land for agriculture and cattle is another threat. There is also caudal reduction due to captures for watering crops in the middle and foothills portions of the Pilcomayo River.
result.conservationmeasures: There are no records of the species in any protected areas of Bolivia. The validity of the species is doubtful since its type locality matches that of paratypes material of A. tarijae and diagnosis is not so clear. Ochoa (2019) suggested that A. ortii is synonymous of A. tarijae.
